image_1.description: The French National Assembly, or lower house, is a legislative body in France where representatives elected by the people convene to make laws and oversee the government. It is the location where Prime Minister Élisabeth Borne informed lawmakers about the government's decision to raise the retirement age, facing heckling and opposition.

Élisabeth Borne is the Prime Minister of France who informed the National Assembly about the government's decision to raise the retirement age. She was met with heckling, booing, and vociferous chanting of the 'Marseillaise,' France’s national anthem, and had to wait for several minutes before being able to speak.

image_3.description: Janet L. Yellen, Treasury Secretary, is a woman with white hair, wearing a black blazer and a patterned scarf, sitting at a desk with papers in front of her. She appears to be speaking or preparing to speak into a microphone and was involved in the call that led to the plan to inject $30 billion into First Republic Bank.
